business.headline: Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why stock markets are in the red today The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex fell 624.64 points to 81,559.53 by 10:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 215.85 points to 24,846.25.

Explained: Why IEX share price gained 11% todayIEX stock opened at Rs 137.00 today, higher than the previous close of Rs 132.45. It climbed further to touch a high of Rs 149.45 in morning trade. As of 9:37 am, the share was trading at Rs 146.80, up 10.84%.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finance shares tumbled 6% despite strong Q1 resultsThe Bajaj Finance stock was down 5.42% at Rs 907 on the BSE at around 9:28 am, while Bajaj Finserv also fell nearly 5%. Bajaj Finance touched an intraday low of Rs 898.10, marking a 6.3% decline.

NSDL IPO: Check price band, GMP, key dates, issue size and moreThe IPO, a pure offer for sale, aims to raise Rs 4,011 crore. It will open for subscription on July 30 and close on August 1, with anchor bids starting a day earlier on July 29.

Sensex falls 300 points at opening, Nifty below 25,000; Bajaj Finance tanks 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.42 points to 81,794.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.70 points to 24,928.40 as of 9:25 am.

IEX stock: Indian Energy Exchange shares to be in focus today. Here's whyIEX shares fell sharply on Thursday, July 24. The stock dropped as much as 28% and touched a 52-week low of Rs 135.26 on the BSE.
Intel layoffs: 25,000 roles at risk as company braces for big reset, says reportIn a letter to employees, Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan acknowledged the difficult period the company is going through.

Why Donald Trump doesn't want Google, Microsoft to hire IndiansSpeaking at an AI Summit in Washington on Wednesday, Donald Trump said American companies must now put national interest first, especially in the fast-growing field of artificial intelligence.

Kristin Cabot, Astronomer HR head, resigns after viral Coldplay kiss-cam scandalAstronomer's HR chief Kristin Cabot resigned days after being caught on a Coldplay kiss-cam with CEO Andy Byron, who also stepped down earlier amid the viral scandal and public backlash.

Billionaire behind your browser: Sundar Pichai's net worth crosses $1 billionAlphabet stock has returned around 120% to investors since 2023 and is now trading close to its all-time high. This has benefited top executives, including Sundar Pichai.

India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

Why some purchases are priceless: Startup founder on spending and living wellWe often treat money decisions like maths problems, but this startup founder says some buys, like a family car or your own home, bring wealth you can't count.

PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Whisky, chocolates, cars: What gets cheaper for Indians after UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

No penalty for missed income tax deadlines? Panel suggests in New Tax BillThe suggestions come from the Select Committee, which has studied the new Income Tax Bill, 2025. This new Bill is meant to replace the old Income Tax Act of 1961.

ED conducts raids on properties linked to Anil Ambani in MumbaiThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday carried out searches at multiple locations in Mumbai connected to industrialist Anil Ambani's companies, days after the State Bank of India (SBI) classified Reliance Communications and Ambani himself as 'fraud'. While his personal residence wasn't searched, ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai targeted premises tied to Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies in connection with an ongoing money laundering investigation.

IEX share price crashes 23% to hit 52-week low. What's behind the fall?IEX shares nosedived after CERC announced phased implementation of market coupling. The move aims to centralise price discovery, challenging IEX's dominance. Investors await clarity from the company's Q1FY26 results.

ED raids Anil Ambani-linked premises in Mumbai days after SBI's 'fraud' tagWhile Anil Ambani's personal residence was not part of the search operation, the ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai visited premises tied to some of his group companies.

NSDL IPO: Check key dates, issue size and other key detailsThe NSDL IPO will open on July 30 and close on August 1, offering 5.01 crore shares through an offer for sale by existing institutional shareholders.

Infosys shares down 1% despite good Q1 results. Should you buy, hold, or sell?Infosys posted a consolidated net profit of Rs 6,921 crore for the June quarter, up 8.7% compared to the same period last year. The revenue grew by 7.5% year-on-year to Rs 42,279 crore.

Investment advisor explains how 'free' stock tip groups scam peopleThe investment advisor explains how so-called "free" stock tip groups on WhatsApp and Telegram are duping thousands of unsuspecting retail investors, all under the guise of financial advice.
Sensex opens 44 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 122.46 points to 82,604.18, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 14.95 points to 25,204.95.

India-US trade deal still pending: Is Trump asking for too much?In the last few weeks, the US has signed several trade agreements with countries such as Vietnam, Indonesia, the Philippines and Japan. But a deal with India remains out of reach.

PM Modi UK visit: All you need to know about India-UK trade deal on the cardsThe free trade agreement will be India's first major bilateral trade deal with a developed country in over 10 years. It is also the most important trade deal the UK has signed since leaving the European Union.

Explained: Why buying flats on hefty EMIs may not be wiseAs returns from residential real estate continue to underwhelm, financial advisors are urging Indians to rethink the emotional appeal of homeownership and consider smarter, more flexible investment avenues for long-term wealth creation.

From aspiration to achievement: Paytm's operational discipline powers profitabilityThe new stock pricing implies that the Noida-based firm will be valued at 63-times of FY27-ended earnings. This revised valuation reflects the brokerage's positive view of Paytm's structural profitability journey, operating leverage, and robust performance in its core business segments.

Sensex up 540 points, Nifty tops 25,200; Tata Motors, Airtel gain over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 539.83 points to 82,726.64 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 159 points higher at 25,219.90. Most of the broader market indices also gained during the trading session.

ED files Rs 1,654-crore case against Myntra over FDI violationsThe investigation comes at a time when e-commerce firms operating in India, particularly those backed by foreign investment, are facing increasing regulatory scrutiny for allegedly bypassing FDI rules through complex business arrangements.

Indiqube Spaces IPO: Should you invest? Check GMP and review by expertsIndiqube Spaces is aiming to raise Rs 700 crore through this IPO. The issue includes a fresh issue of 2.74 crore shares worth Rs 650 crore and an offer for sale of 21 lakh shares valued at Rs 50 crore.

Mumbai's luxury real estate market hits Rs 14,750 crore salesEven as affordability worsens for the middle class, Mumbai's luxury real estate market continues to soar, fuelled by billionaires, upgraders and a fresh pipeline of designer residences in coveted neighbourhoods.

SRK and Big B back this IPO: All you need to know about Sri Lotus DevelopersOther celebrities, including Hrithik Roshan, Ajay Devgn, Ektaa Kapoor, Sara Ali Khan, Tiger Shroff, and Rajkummar Rao have also invested in the firm as per reports.

entertainment.headline: Ananya Panday launches kindness curriculum to teach children empathy and artActor Ananya Panday is taking her mission of spreading kindness to the next level with the launch of a Kindness Curriculum under her So Positive platform, in collaboration with NGO Slam Out Loud.

Chaos breaks out at Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu UK screening, video viralFans of the film 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' caused a disruption at a UK theatre by throwing confetti during the screening, leading to widespread criticism and the screening being halted. The film, starring Pawan Kalyan, has received mixed reviews in India for its ambitious storyline but flawed execution.

Johny Lever's daughter Jamie recalls being asked to strip in scam auditionJamie Lever, actor-comedian and daughter of Johny Lever, recently recalled a disturbing audition experience where she was asked to strip. She shared that while she had been informed the role was 'bold', the audition quickly took an uncomfortable and inappropriate turn.

War 2 trailer: It's Hrithik Roshan vs Jr NTR in a never-seen-before action sagaThe much-anticipated trailer for 'War 2', starring the never-seen-before actor-duo Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR is out. The film, a sequel to the 2019 film 'War', is scheduled for an Independence Day release.

Fantastic Four First Steps review: Marvel's first family gets a well-deserved reboot Release Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Marvel's 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' refreshes the classic superhero team with a nostalgic yet modern twist, set in a vibrant 1960s retro-futuristic universe. The film shines through its heartfelt character moments and stylish visuals, making it a promising new beginning for the franchise despite some familiar villain shortcomings.

Fahadh Faasil wants to drive an Uber in Barcelona after his retirementMalayalam actor Fahadh Faasil has shared his heartfelt retirement dream of driving an Uber in Barcelona, highlighting his love for simple joys beyond cinema. The actor is currently promoting his latesy film 'Mareesan'.

Su From So review: A superb natural comedy that doubles up as social dramaRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Su From So movie review: Directed by JP Thuminad, this Kannada comedy is a fun ride filled with laughter throughout. The film weaves social drama with comedy and presents a beautiful story.

Tara Sutaria finds cheerleader in Veer Pahariya at fashion show. Watch VideoActor Tara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya's chemistry at a recent fashion show added fuel to dating rumours. Their subtle gestures caught the fans' attention. They also clicked while leaving the event together as well.

Rangeen review: Bold gigolo drama loses impact in executionRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Rangeen series review: 'Rangeen' is a bold series about a man turning gigolo for revenge. The show, featuring Viineet Kumar Siingh and Rajshri Deshpande, struggles with tone and underdeveloped characters despite boasting an intriguing premise.

Mahavatar Narsimha review: Emotionally uplifting tale about devotion, compassionRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025'Mahavatar Narsimha' movie review: 'Mahavatar Narsimha' narrates the story of a young child named Prahlad's devotion to Lord Vishnu. The film makes a powerful statement about faith, compassion, hatred and devotion. Is the animation movie worth your time? Here is our review.

Who is Heisenberg, Tamil cinema's anonymous lyricist? Here's an interesting clueTamil cinema boasts a lyricist named Heisenberg, who is known only by his name. Director Lokesh Kanagaraj, who has worked with him, gave a clue without blowing his cover.

Sarzameen review: A film that forgets Sar, loses Zameen, still thinks it's patrioticRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Sarzameen movie review: In this Ibrahim Ali Khan, Kajol and Prithviraj Sukumaran-starrer, neither the patriotism lands nor the emotional family drama connects. What you get instead is a hollow story trying hard to feel important.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendNetflix's new weekend lineup caters to a diverse audience base. From intense crime-dramas to spine-chilling horror as well as fantasy and comedy genres, there is a mix of various themes in this weekend's releases which appeals to all viewers.
Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendFrom thrillers to crime dramas and reality series, here's what you can watch on JioHotstar this weekend.

Blackpink's Lisa debuts on Netflix's Hitmakers, rejects rough tracksAfter much excitement, Lisa makes her Netflix debut on 'Hitmakers'. Twelve producers present original songs to her, but only one track wins her approval.

Shaan Grover on 'Mahesh Dalle' memes after Saiyaara: Was initially disturbedActor Shaan Grover, in an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, spoke about the criticism he received for his role in 'Saiyaara'. The film stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda in the lead.

Singer Babla Mehta, known as Voice of Mukesh, dies in MumbaiSinger Babla Mehta, known as the Voice of Mukesh, died on July 22 in Mumbai. He also sang alongside legendary singer Late Lata Mangeskar in the film 'Chandni'.

As Masaan turns 10, Shweta Tripathi discusses why it's relevance will never fadeShweta Tripathi, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, spoke about her debut film 'Masaan' as it completed a decade today. The actor opened up about the timeless social relevance of the Neeraj Ghaywan-directorial, and how the movie continues to hold a special place in her heart.

The Summer I Turned Pretty just got ringed and entered its villain eraThe latest episode of The Summer I Turned Pretty is here and everybody is talking about it. Jeremiah proposes to Belly and everything turns into chaos, here's why.

general news.headline: 6 students dead, over 15 injured as school roof collapses in Rajasthan's JhalawarThe roof of a primary school collapsed in Rajasthan's Jhalawar on Friday morning, leaving four students dead and at least 17 injured. Several others are feared trapped under the debris.

Kamal Haasan makes Parliament debut, takes oath in Tamil as Rajya Sabha MPActor and MNM chief Kamal Haasan took oath in Tamil as a Rajya Sabha MP on Friday. Backed by DMK, he was elected unopposed after opting for a Parliament seat over the Lok Sabha polls.

Rape-murder convict caught hours after escaping Kerala jail, was serving life termGovindachamy, convicted in the 2011 Soumya rape and murder case, escaped from Kannur Central Jail but was caught hours later. CCTV footage surfaced. Jail DGP confirmed his arrest and promised action.

'Talibani era' in Bangladesh? Dress code for women, protest gag order spark rowEarlier this week, the Bangladesh Bank caused a storm after it barred women employees from wearing short dresses and clothing with short sleeves. After a backlash, it withdrew the order.

The film shines through its heartfelt character moments and stylish visuals, making it a promising new beginning for the franchise despite some familiar villain shortcomings.

Dharmasthala mass-burial case: 5 big questions that raise a stinkA probe by an SIT has been ordered by the Karnataka government into allegations that mass burials of raped and murdered women were carried out over the years in Dharmasthala, a popular temple town. Despite the claims by a whistleblower, there are several unanswered questions that make the case curious.

Poll body initiates Vice President election process, appoints key officialsThe Election Commission has begun the process to elect the next Vice President of India, appointing Rajya Sabha Secretary General PC Mody as Returning Officer and two officials as Assistant Returning Officers.

How the mammoth Bihar voter roll revision is unfolding on the groundThe exercise has been a mixed bag: over 90 per cent voters tracked, 1.86 million reported deceased, 2.6 million shifted, 750,000 on multiple lists and 11,000 untraceable

Ramp walk? Nah. Manish Malhotra is throwing a couture party at ICW 2025Manish Malhotra is leaving the catwalk behind this time to create a fully immersive, intimate, and high-fashion experience that throws the spotlight on couture in a completely new way.

Barcelona legend Xavi applies for coaching role, AIFF rejects: ReportThe AIFF was left stumped after the legendary Spanish midfielder, Xavi Hernandez had applied for the role of India's new head coach after Manolo Marquez's departure from the role.

After 15,000 job cuts, Satya Nadella admits Microsoft's AI shift feels messyMicrosoft CEO Satya Nadella's latest memo strikes a delicate balance, acknowledging the human cost of change while steering Microsoft toward an AI-driven future that promises growth, but not without sacrifice.

PM lands in Maldives, shares warm hug with Muizzu amid focus on diplomatic resetPrime Minister Narendra Modi reached Male to attend the Maldives' 60th Independence Day as Guest of Honour, becoming the first foreign head of state to visit under President Mohamed Muizzu's tenure.

Narendra Modi breaks Indira Gandhi's record, becomes 2nd longest serving PMNarendra Modi crossed 4,078 consecutive days in office, surpassing Indira Gandhi's record and cementing his place as India's longest-serving non-Congress Prime Minister.
Rajasthan man kicks, punches mother over property dispute; arrestedThe mother, Santosh Bai, 65, has registered a case against her son, Deepu Mehra, at the Anantpura Police Station.

Remember the Kinetic DX? It is coming back this monthThere was something about the Kinetic DX that made it sci-fi way back in the 80s and 90s. Capitalising on this sentiment, Kinetic is all set to bring it back in an all-new avatar. Here are all the details.

How India's strategic assets lie exposed, vulnerable to harmWith detailed imagery of military bases, nuclear plants, border posts and more easily accessible to Open Source Intelligence, how dangerous is this for national security?

Student beaten in Mumbai over distributing wedding invitation card in MarathiA college student in Navi Mumbai was allegedly beaten for distributing a wedding invite in Marathi. The incident sparked political outrage, with the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena demanding strict action.
Intel layoffs: 25,000 roles at risk as company braces for big reset, says reportIn a letter to employees, Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan acknowledged the difficult period the company is going through.

14 dead, over 1 lakh displaced as Thailand-Cambodia border clashes escalateThailand-Cambodia conflict: The clashes mark the most serious confrontation between the two Southeast Asian neighbours in over a decade over a long-disputed border.

China presses Pak army chief on citizens' security, reaffirms iron-clad supportPakistani army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir, in his first visit to China after the hostilities with India in May, underscored that their time-tested partnership was solid as a rock.

sports.headline: Just not cricket: Should Stokes and Archer have attacked Pant's broken toe?ENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant sustained a toe injury on Day 1 at Old Trafford, but the left-handed batter returned to score a gutsy half-century on the second day, helping India put up a score of 358 on the board.

If Rishabh Pant's bravery doesn't lift India, nothing will: Ravi ShastriENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant showed grit and came out to bat in Manchester despite a toe injury. He scored 54 runs and helped India put up 358 on the board in the first innings.

Barcelona legend Xavi applies for coaching role, AIFF rejects: ReportThe AIFF was left stumped after the legendary Spanish midfielder, Xavi Hernandez had applied for the role of India's new head coach after Manolo Marquez's departure from the role.

Obsession with batting: Ashwin slams India for underutilising KuldeepENG vs IND, 4th Test: Former Indian spinner R Ashwin questioned India's priorities in the series against England, urging the team to value wicket-taking ability over marginal lower-order runs.

Shubman Gill's tactics slammed by Ponting: Bumrah bowled from wrong endRicky Ponting was heavily critical of Shubman Gill's captaincy on Day 2 of the Manchester Test. The former Australian skipper reckons that Gill has gotten it wrong tactically giving England a quick start in the first innings.

Poor India handed Rishabh Pant's runs back to England: Nasser HussainENG vs IND, 4th Test: Nasser Hussain said that India were poor in their tactics on Day 2, allowing England to dominate in the ongoing Test at the Old Trafford in Manchester.

Yash Dayal in more trouble, faces another sexual harassment caseAn FIR has been registered against cricketer Yash Dayal after a woman accused him of sexually assaulting her over two years, allegedly using emotional manipulation and false promises of helping her build a cricket career to exploit her.

It wasn't intentional: Crawley hits back at Shubman's 90 seconds claimENG vs IND, 4th Test: England opener Zak Crawley responded to Shubman Gill's claims that England were 90 seconds late to come out to bat in their second innings of the Lord's Test.

Rishabh Pant's pain-bearing capacity is high, spirit unmatched: Shardul ThakurIndia all-rounder Shardul Thakur hailed Rishabh Pant for his immense pain-bearing capacity as the wicketkeeper-batter battled through a toe fracture to bat for the team during the fourth Test at Old Trafford in Manchester.

DRS: Is it time for injury replacements in cricket?Rishabh Pant braved the pain to come out and bat for India on Day 2 of the Manchester Test after suffering a broken toe. While Pant won hearts with his bravery, was it a move that was necessary? Could we have a system where a substitute for a seriously injured player can be brought in to maintain the balance between both sides? In the latest edition of India Today's Democratic Review System, we discuss whether substitutes are needed in cricket.

Hulk Hogan dies: Cena, Triple H and wrestling world mourn death of WWE legendJohn Cena, Triple H and the wrestling world paid their tributes to Hulk Hogan after the WWE Hall Of Famer passed away on Thursday, July 24. Hogan leaves behind a rich legacy as one of the greatest of all time in wrestling history.

AB de Villiers goes berserk, slams 41-ball century vs England Champions in WCLSouth Africa Champions captain AB de Villiers clobbered a 41-ball hundred during Match 8 of the World Championship of Legends (WCL) against England Champions and guided them to a 10-wicket win.

Manchester Test: Injured Pant puts up brave fight, but bowlers drop the ballManchester Test, Day 2: Rishabh Pant showed great courage batting with a fractured toe to push India's total past 350. However, India's bowling unit failed to contain England as they reduced the deficit significantly by stumps.

Seifert, Rachin and Sodhi help New Zealand thump Zimbabwe before finalTim Seifert and Ish Sodhi starred as New Zealand defeated Zimbabwe by 60 runs in the tri-series. The win keeps New Zealand unbeaten and gain momentum ahead of their final against South Africa.

Koneru Humpy sets up historic all-Indian Women's World Cup final vs Divya DeshmukhGrandmaster Koneru Humpy advanced to the final of the FIDE Women's World Cup after a thrilling tiebreak victory over China's Lei Tingjie. She will face 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh in the first-ever all-Indian final.

Pakistan avoid embarrassing clean sweep in Bangladesh, win 3rd T20I in DhakaBAN vs PAK, 3rd T20I: Pakistan rode on a quick-fire 63 from Sahibzada Farhan and an all-round bowling effort to hammer Bangladesh by 74 runs and avoid a clean sweep in Dhaka.

WWE great Hulk Hogan dies at 71 due to cardiac arrestLegendary American wrestler Hulk Hogan died due to cardiac arrest, aged 71, on Thursday, WWE confirmed on Thursday. Hogan helped World Wrestling Entertainment catapult into mainstream popularity in the 1980s.

N Jagadeesan to be added to India squad as cover for injured Rishabh PantN Jagadeesan is reportedly being roped in as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant for the remainder of the England vs India series. Pant came out to bat despite his injury on Day 2 of the Manchester Test.

Newcastle United's Alexander Isak keen to explore transfer options: ReportAlexander Isak has reportedly told Newcastle United of his desire to leave the club and explore his options with another club.

This is character: Sanjiv Goenka salutes Pant's fight in Manchester TestENG vs IND: Rishabh Pant received massive praise from the Lucknow Super Giants owner, Sanjiv Goenka for his resolve and willpower to come out and bat despite the concerning injury on his foot.

Watch: Manchester gives standing ovation as injured Pant walks out to batThe Old Trafford crowd were up on their feet as Rishabh Pant braved through the pain to come to bat on Day 2 of the Manchester Test.

Tsitsipas parts ways with coach Goran Ivanisevic after disappointing runTsitsipas' split with Ivanisevic marks another chapter in his ongoing struggle to recapture past brilliance—one that now demands both a rethink and a reset.

Injured Rishabh Pant available to bat if needed, won't keep wicketsIndia vs England: Rishabh Pant is available to bat if required, despite sustaining a foot injury on Day 1 of the ongoing Manchester Test.

Should have been more proactive: RP Singh criticises Jaiswal's approachENG vs IND: RP Singh said that Yashasvi Jaiswal should have been more proactive in his knock at the Old Trafford where he scored 58 runs before Liam Dawson accounted for his wicket.

17-year-old Unnati Hooda stuns PV Sindhu in round of 16Indian teenage badminton sensation Unnati Hooda stunned senior compatriot PV Sindhu with a commanding victory in their Round of 16 clash at the China Open 2025 on Thursday.

BCCI agrees to host Asia Cup at neutral venue, India-Pak likely in same groupAsia Cup 2025: The Indian cricket board has agreed to host the T20 tournament at a neutral venue. Discussions about the tournament were held at Thursday's Asian Cricket Council meeting.

South Africa name squads for Australia tour, Pretorius earns ODI call-upAiden Markram and Temba Bavuma made their comebacks while Lhuan-dre Pretorius earned a maiden ODI call-up as Australia named their squads for the tour of Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
